meanings.definition: The last part of a piece of music, a performance, or a public event.
meanings.sent1: The finales of the concert were filled with excitement and applause.
meanings.sent2: The opera's finale left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent3: The finale of the school play had everyone cheering for the talented actors.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the finale of the outdoor concert painted the sky with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The grand finale of the fireworks display lit up the night sky with a dazzling array of colors.

meanings.definition: The concluding part of a play, movie, or television program.
meanings.sent1: The movie's finales always leave viewers wanting more.
meanings.sent2: The finale of the TV show revealed a surprising plot twist.
meanings.sent3: In the finale of the play, the characters finally resolved their conflicts.
meanings.sent4: The finale of the mystery movie kept everyone on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent5: The emotional finale of the series brought tears to the audience's eyes.

meanings.definition: The last game in a series of games, especially in sports.
meanings.sent1: The team's finales are always intense and full of suspense.
meanings.sent2: The finale of the championship match determined the winner.
meanings.sent3: In the finale of the tournament, the underdog team emerged victorious.
meanings.sent4: The finale of the season had fans on the edge of their seats until the very end.
meanings.sent5: The climactic finale of the competition showcased the players' skills and determination.
